newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar slightly weaker but movements thin.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar slightly weaker but movements thin.

text.p: Turnover was solid on the white sugar futures market on Wednesday but price movements remained slight as raw sugar futures failed to give direction to London, traders said.
Activity was broadly confined to the front three positions with outright purchases peppered with switches and crosses seen from brokerages.
By 1519 GMT overall volume totalled 1,806 lots, with the bulk coming from the spot October contract at 1,318 lots.
Most positions weakened slightly after the New York opening and nearby white sugar spreads remained relatively steady.
October was down 80 cents at $352.50 after moving in a $3.00 range and December down 80 cents at $346.00.

Earlier in the session, buying from one leading commission house boosted October's value to its life-high of $355.50 before values slipped back. Traders said a fund might have been behind the buy orders.
The same house then sold October positions for a different client, traders said.
By testing resistance at the high, October has now come full circle on the charts after slumping to score two spike lows either side of $340.
In physical news, Algeria was said to be in the market on Wednesday to buy one cargo of 45 ICUMSA white sugar, most likely for prompt arrival.
Traders said no deal had so far been struck as a result of Algeria's weekend tender to buy between 12,000 and 14,000 tonnes of 100 or 150 ICUMSA sugars for October delivery.
Movements were also marginal in Paris where 733 lots were traded on the Matif exchange. October was up just 10 cents at $353.10 and December down 50 cents at $347.00.
